content.prompt:
The x axis ranges from negative 3 to 6 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 5 to 13 in increments of 1. Moving from left to right:

  • The curve enters the window at approximately (negative 2.2 comma 13.5).
  • The curve decreases sharply then levels off reaching a low point at the origin.
  • The curve then gradually increases to reach its steepest point at the labeled point (2 comma sixteen thirds). 
  • The curve then increases, gradually leveling off to approximately (4 comma 10.8), increasing less and less as it continues.
  • The curve then gradually decreases from the high point at (4 comma 10.8) to cross the x axis at (6 comma 0) and exit the window at approximately (6.3 comma negative 5) where it is steepest.

​The graph of the function f is given for -3≤x≤6. Which of the following statements about the rate of change of f over the interval 2<x<6 is true?

choices.label: ​The rate of change is positive.
​The rate of change is negative.
​The rate of change is increasing.
​The rate of change is decreasing.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
